review the logs! You can access them via the Codabench user interface:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003col dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eGo to the \"Submission\" tab and scroll to the end of the page to find your submission.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eClick on the row corresponding to your submission.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSelect the \"Logs\" tab.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eBrowse the various types of logs available: \u003ccode\u003estdout\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003estderr\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eIngestion stdout\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003eIngestion stderr\u003c/code\u003e, for both the ingestion and scoring steps.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ol\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eHow to configure my environment?\u003c/h2\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-how-to-configure-my-environment\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: How to configure my environment?\" href=\"#how-to-configure-my-environment\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTry interactive docker or conda environnement, it is especially useful for python users!\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eA conda environment is provided. Follow these steps to install and activate it. Retrieve the file \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/bcm-uga/hadaca3/blob/main/docker/codabench_hadaca_final/environment/env_final_pyr.yml\"\u003eenv_final_pyr.yml\u003c/a\u003e from GitHub as follow:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bcm-uga/hadaca3/refs/heads/main/docker/codabench_hadaca_final/environment/env_final_pyr.yml\nconda env create -f env_final_pyr.yml \u0026amp;\u0026amp; conda activate h3_final\"\u003e\u003cpre class=\"notranslate\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003ewget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bcm-uga/hadaca3/refs/heads/main/docker/codabench_hadaca_final/environment/env_final_pyr.yml\nconda env create -f env_final_pyr.yml \u0026amp;\u0026amp; conda activate h3_final\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTo run the docker interactively you can run:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"## for the R version\nsudo docker run -it -v .:/hadaca3 -w /hadaca3 hombergn/hadaca3_final R\nsource(\u0026quot;submission_script.R\u0026quot;) \n## for the python version\nsudo docker run -it -v .:/hadaca3 -w /hadaca3 hombergn/hadaca3_final python\nimport submission_script\"\u003e\u003cpre class=\"notranslate\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003e## for the R version\nsudo docker run -it -v .:/hadaca3 -w /hadaca3 hombergn/hadaca3_final R\nsource(\"submission_script.R\") \n## for the python version\nsudo docker run -it -v .:/hadaca3 -w /hadaca3 hombergn/hadaca3_final python\nimport submission_script\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eDue to the usage of the super user (sudo) all files created by docker will be owned by root. In order to retrieve ownership, you can use this command:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"sudo chown -R $USER submissions\"\u003e\u003cpre class=\"notranslate\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003esudo chown -R $USER submissions\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eBeware that Mac users with M1 processors might encounter problems.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eHow to run submissions ingestion and scoring locally with Docker?\u003c/h2\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-how-to-run-submissions-ingestion-and-scoring-locally-with-docker\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: How to run submissions ingestion and scoring locally with Docker?\" href=\"#how-to-run-submissions-ingestion-and-scoring-locally-with-docker\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTo speed up the debugging process and avoid the full submission workflow, you can run your submission program locally using \u003cstrong\u003eFAKE\u003c/strong\u003e data. The fake data serves two purposes: first, it allows testing without relying on the actual scoring program (which requires the ground truth), and second, it speeds up computation.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTo test locally, follow these steps:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"# Clone the challenge repository:\ngit clone https://github.com/bcm-uga/hadaca3.git\ncd hadaca3\n\n# Set up the environment and activate it:\nconda env create -f environment-r.yml \u0026amp;\u0026amp; conda activate h3\n\n# Run the automated Docker test script:\nsh automated_docker_test.sh\"\u003e\u003cpre class=\"notranslate\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003e# Clone the activate h3\n\n# Run the automated Docker test script:\nsh automated_docker_test.sh\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003ePlease note that this script will use the \u003ccode\u003esubmission_script.R\u003c/code\u003e from the \u003ccode\u003estarting_kit/\u003c/code\u003e folder.\nEnsure that your script is placed inside the \u003ccode\u003estarting_kit/\u003c/code\u003e folder or modify the existing script at \u003ccode\u003estarting_kit/submission_script.R\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe script \u003ccode\u003eautomated_docker_test.sh\u003c/code\u003e first executes the R submission script locally, then re-executes it within the Docker container (ingestion phase), followed by running the scoring program.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf you wish to test each step independently or run the Python script locally, refer to the \u003ccode\u003eREADME.md\u003c/code\u003e in the \u003ccode\u003ehadaca3\u003c/code\u003e GitHub repository.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" container-lg" itemprop="text"><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">FAQ</h1><a id="user-content-faq" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: FAQ" href="#faq"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Why did my submission fail?</h2><a id="user-content-why-did-my-submission-fail" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Why did my submission fail?" href="#why-did-my-submission-fail"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">Have a look at the logs on Codabench.
If your submission fails on Codabench, don't panic, review the logs! You can access them via the Codabench user interface:</p>
<ol dir="auto">
<li>Go to the "Submission" tab and scroll to the end of the page to find your submission.</li>
<li>Click on the row corresponding to your submission.</li>
<li>Select the "Logs" tab.</li>
<li>Browse the various types of logs available: <code>stdout</code>, <code>stderr</code>, <code>Ingestion stdout</code>, and <code>Ingestion stderr</code>, for both the ingestion and scoring steps.</li>
</ol>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">How to configure my environment?</h2><a id="user-content-how-to-configure-my-environment" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: How to configure my environment?" href="#how-to-configure-my-environment"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">Try interactive docker or conda environnement, it is especially useful for python users!</p>
<p dir="auto">A conda environment is provided. Follow these steps to install and activate it. Retrieve the file <a href="https://github.com/bcm-uga/hadaca3/blob/main/docker/codabench_hadaca_final/environment/env_final_pyr.yml">env_final_pyr.yml</a> from GitHub as follow:</p>
<div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bcm-uga/hadaca3/refs/heads/main/docker/codabench_hadaca_final/environment/env_final_pyr.yml
conda env create -f env_final_pyr.yml &amp;&amp; conda activate h3_final"><pre class="notranslate"><code>wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bcm-uga/hadaca3/refs/heads/main/docker/codabench_hadaca_final/environment/env_final_pyr.yml
conda env create -f env_final_pyr.yml &amp;&amp; conda activate h3_final
</code></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">To run the docker interactively you can run:</p>
<div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="## for the R version
sudo docker run -it -v .:/hadaca3 -w /hadaca3 hombergn/hadaca3_final R
source(&quot;submission_script.R&quot;) 
## for the python version
sudo docker run -it -v .:/hadaca3 -w /hadaca3 hombergn/hadaca3_final python
import submission_script"><pre class="notranslate"><code>## for the R version
sudo docker run -it -v .:/hadaca3 -w /hadaca3 hombergn/hadaca3_final R
source("submission_script.R") 
## for the python version
sudo docker run -it -v .:/hadaca3 -w /hadaca3 hombergn/hadaca3_final python
import submission_script
</code></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Due to the usage of the super user (sudo) all files created by docker will be owned by root. In order to retrieve ownership, you can use this command:</p>
<div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="sudo chown -R $USER submissions"><pre class="notranslate"><code>sudo chown -R $USER submissions
</code></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Beware that Mac users with M1 processors might encounter problems.</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">How to run submissions ingestion and scoring locally with Docker?</h2><a id="user-content-how-to-run-submissions-ingestion-and-scoring-locally-with-docker" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: How to run submissions ingestion and scoring locally with Docker?" href="#how-to-run-submissions-ingestion-and-scoring-locally-with-docker"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">To speed up the debugging process and avoid the full submission workflow, you can run your submission program locally using <strong>FAKE</strong> data. The fake data serves two purposes: first, it allows testing without relying on the actual scoring program (which requires the ground truth), and second, it speeds up computation.</p>
<p dir="auto">To test locally, follow these steps:</p>
<div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="# Clone the challenge repository:
git clone https://github.com/bcm-uga/hadaca3.git
cd hadaca3

# Set up the environment and activate it:
conda env create -f environment-r.yml &amp;&amp; conda activate h3

# Run the automated Docker test script:
sh automated_docker_test.sh"><pre class="notranslate"><code># Clone the challenge repository:
git clone https://github.com/bcm-uga/hadaca3.git
cd hadaca3

# Set up the environment and activate it:
conda env create -f environment-r.yml &amp;&amp; conda activate h3

# Run the automated Docker test script:
sh automated_docker_test.sh
</code></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Please note that this script will use the <code>submission_script.R</code> from the <code>starting_kit/</code> folder.
Ensure that your script is placed inside the <code>starting_kit/</code> folder or modify the existing script at <code>starting_kit/submission_script.R</code>.</p>
<p dir="auto">The script <code>automated_docker_test.sh</code> first executes the R submission script locally, then re-executes it within the Docker container (ingestion phase), followed by running the scoring program.</p>
<p dir="auto">If you wish to test each step independently or run the Python script locally, refer to the <code>README.md</code> in the <code>hadaca3</code> GitHub repository.</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">How to include an external file to be used in the submission script?</h2><a id="user-content-how-to-include-an-external-file-to-be-used-in-the-submission-script" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: How to include an external file to be used in the submission script?" href="#how-to-include-an-external-file-to-be-used-in-the-submission-script"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">It is possible to include an external file that is sourced in the submission script and correctly included in the zip file to be submitted on the Codabench platform.
Beware, when unzipped the file 'program.R' has to be on the current directory and not inside a folder. Additionnal files can be located in other folders with the correct relative path.</p>
